data.Sentence_cn: 课文17  人为的疾病
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 17 A man-made disease

data.Sentence_cn: 什么因素有助于多发性粘液瘤病的传播?
data.Sentence: What factor helped to spread the disease of myxomatosis?

data.Sentence_cn: 在澳大利亚移民初期，一些有创业精神的移民不明智地把欧洲兔子引进了澳大利亚。
data.Sentence: In the early days of the settlement of Australia, enterprising settlers unwisely introduced the European rabbit.

data.Sentence_cn: 这种兔子在澳大利亚及新西兰没有天敌，因此便以兔子所特有的杂乱交配迅猛繁殖起来。
data.Sentence: This rabbit had no natural enemies in the Antipodes, so that it multiplied with that promiscuous abandon characteristic of rabbits.

data.Sentence_cn: 整个澳洲兔子成灾。
data.Sentence: It overran a whole continent.

data.Sentence_cn: 它们在地下打洞，吃掉本可以饲养数百万头牛羊的牧草，给澳洲大陆造成了毁灭性的破坏。
data.Sentence: It caused devastation by burrowing and by devouring the herbage which might have maintained millions of sheep and cattle.

data.Sentence_cn: 科学家们发现，这种特殊品种的兔子（显然不包括别的动物）易患一种叫“多发性粘液瘤”的致命毒性疾病。
data.Sentence: Scientists discovered that this particular variety of rabbit (and apparently no other animal) was susceptible to a fatal virus disease, myxomatosis.

data.Sentence_cn: 通过让染上此病的动物在洞内乱跑，就可以使这种疾病在一个地区蔓延起来。
data.Sentence: By infecting animals and letting them loose in the burrows, local epidemics of this disease could be created.

data.Sentence_cn: 后来又发现，有一种蚊子是传播这种疾病的媒介，能把此病传染给兔子。
data.Sentence: Later it was found that there was a type of mosquito which acted as the carrier of this disease and passed it on to the rabbits.

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，世界上其他地方在设法消灭蚊子的时候，澳大利亚却在促使这种蚊子大量繁殖。
data.Sentence: So while the rest of the world was trying to get rid of mosquitoes, Australia was encouraging this one.

data.Sentence_cn: 蚊子把这种疾病扩散到整个澳洲大陆，效果甚佳，结果兔子的数目在为减少。
data.Sentence: It effectively spread the disease all over the continent and drastically reduced the rabbit population.

data.Sentence_cn: 后来，明显看出，兔子对这种疾病已产生了一定程度的免疫力，
data.Sentence: It later became apparent that rabbits were developing a degree of resistance to this disease,

data.Sentence_cn: 所以兔子不可能被完全消灭。
data.Sentence: so that the rabbit population was unlikely to be completely exterminated.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，已有希望解决兔子所带来的问题。
data.Sentence: There were hopes, however, that the problem of the rabbit would become manageable.

data.Sentence_cn: 具有讽刺意味的是，欧洲把这种兔子作为有害动物传给澳洲，而欧洲自己却染上了这种人为的瘟疫般的疾病。
data.Sentence: Ironically, Europe, which had bequeathed the rabbit as a pest to Australia, acquired this man-made disease as a pestilence.

data.Sentence_cn: 一位法国内科医生决定除掉自己庄园内的野兔子，于是引进了这种多发性粘液瘤疾病。
data.Sentence: A French physician decided to get rid of the wild rabbits on his own estate and introduced myxomatosis.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而，这种疾病并未被局限在他的庄园内，
data.Sentence: It did not, however, remain within the confines of this estate.

data.Sentence_cn: 结果在整个法国蔓延开来。野兔在法国一般不被当作有害动物，而被视为打猎取乐的玩物和有用的食物来源。
data.Sentence: It spread through France, where wild rabbits are not generally regarded as a pest but as a sport and a useful food supply,

data.Sentence_cn: 这种疾病又蔓延到了英国。在英国，野兔被当作有害的动物，
data.Sentence: and it spread to Britain where wild rabbits are regarded as a pest but where domesticated rabbits,

data.Sentence_cn: 然而家兔同样易感染这种疾病，可是家兔是赚钱的毛皮工业的基础。
data.Sentence: equally susceptible to the disease, are the basis of a profitable fur industry.

data.Sentence_cn: 现在的问题是，人类能否控制住这种人为的疾病。
data.Sentence: The question became one of whether Man could control the disease he had invented.
